required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Linagliptin 2.5 mg Twice Daily Versus 5 mg Once Daily as add-on Therapy to Twice Daily Metformin in Type 2 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: 12 Week Randomised Double-blind BI 1356 2.5 mg Bid vs 5 mg qd add-on to Metformin

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the study is to investigate the efficacy and safety of linagliptin 2.5 mg twice daily compared to 5 mg once daily compared to placebo given orally for 12 weeks as add-on therapy to metformin in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus with insufficient glycaemic control. It is planned to show non-inferiority of linagliptin 2.5 mg twice daily compared to 5 mg once daily and each treatment's superiority over placebo.

primary_outcome.measure: HbA1c Change From Baseline at Week 12
primary_outcome.description: HbA1c is measured as a percentage. Thus, this change from baseline reflects the Week 12 HbA1c percent minus the baseline HbA1c percent. Treatment means are adjusted for baseline HbA1c and use of prior oral antidiabetics (OADs) in addition to background metformin.

secondary_outcome.measure: HbA1c Change From Baseline at Week 6 From Mixed Model Repeated Measures (MMRM) Analysis
secondary_outcome.description: Mixed model includes treatment, baseline HbA1c, use of prior oral antidiabetics (OADs) in addition to background metformin, week repeated within patient, week by treatment interaction.

secondary_outcome.measure: HbA1c Change From Baseline at Week 12 From Mixed Model Repeated Measures (MMRM) Analysis
secondary_outcome.description: Mixed model includes treatment, baseline HbA1c, use of prior oral antidiabetics (OADs) in addition to background metformin, week repeated within patient, week by treatment interaction.

secondary_outcome.measure: FPG Change From Baseline at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline reflects the Week 12 FPG minus the baseline FPG. Treatment means are adjusted for baseline HbA1c, baseline fasting plasma glucose and use of prior oral antidiabetics (OADs) in addition to background metformin.

secondary_outcome.measure: FPG Change From Baseline at Week 6 From Mixed Model Repeated Measures (MMRM) Analysis
secondary_outcome.description: Mixed model includes treatment, baseline HbA1c, baseline FPG, use of prior oral antidiabetics (OADs) in addition to background metformin, week repeated within patient, week by treatment interaction.

secondary_outcome.measure: FPG Change From Baseline at Week 12 From Mixed Model Repeated Measures (MMRM) Analysis
secondary_outcome.description: Mixed model includes treatment, baseline HbA1c, baseline FPG, use of prior oral antidiabetics (OADs) in addition to background metformin, week repeated within patient, week by treatment interaction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With HbA1c Lowering by 0.5% or More at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients with HbA1c lowering by at least 0.5% after 12 weeks. The analysis was performed on the full analysis set (FAS) using NCF.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Rescue Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients with rescue therapy at Week 12. The analysis was performed on the full analysis set (FAS) using OC.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Occurrence of a Treat to Target Efficacy Response (HbA1c <7.0%) After 12 Weeks of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of those patients with baseline HbA1c >= 7.0% who had HbA1c < 7% at Week 12. The analysis was performed on the full analysis set (FAS) using NCF.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Occurrence of a Treat to Target Efficacy Response (HbA1c <6.5 %) After 12 Weeks of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of those patients with baseline HbA1c >= 6.5% who had HbA1c < 6.5% at Week 12. The analysis was performed on the full analysis set (FAS) using NCF.

intervention.description: patient to receive tablets containing low dose linagliptin twice daily
patient to receive placebo tablet(s) matching linagliptin
patient to receive a tablet containing medium dose linagliptin once daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria
1. Diagnosis of type 2 diabetes mellitus.
2. Current treatment with metformin alone (>/= 1500 mg or maximally tolerated dose) or metformin plus 1 other antidiabetic drug. Metformin must be administered in twice daily dosing regimen. Patients taking metformin three times daily can be included if posology is switched to twice daily and total daily dose is maintained.
3. Glycosylated haemoglobin (HbA1c) is between 7.0% - 10.0%.
4. Body Mass Index (BMI) </=45 kg/m2.
Exclusion criteria
1. Treatment with extended release metformin.
2. Uncontrolled hyperglycaemia (fasting plasma glucose > 240 mg/dL or 13.3 mmol/L).
3. Myocardial infarction (MI), stroke or transient ischaemic attack (TIA) within 6 months prior to informed consent.
4. Impaired hepatic or renal function, or gastric bypass surgery.
5. Treatment with glitazones, glucagon like peptide-1 (GLP-1) analogues/mimetics, antiobesity agents, or insulin within 3 months of informed consent.
6. Current treatment with systemic steroids or change in dosage of thyroid hormones.
7. Alcohol or drug abuse within 3 months of informed consent.
8. Participation in another trial with investigational drug within 2 months prior to informed consent.
9. Pre-menopausal women who are nursing, pregnant or not practicing an acceptable method of birth control.

measure.title: Glycosylated hemoglobin (HbA1c)
measure.description: Baseline HbA1c was determined for the Full Analysis Set with 43 patients treated with Placebo, 214 patients treated with Linagliptin 2.5 bid and 221 patients treated with Linagliptin 5mg qd (478 in total).

measure.title: Fasting blood plasma glucose (FPG)
measure.description: Baseline FPG was determined for the Full Analysis Set (where FPG values were also available) with 41 patients treated with Placebo, 209 patients treated with Linagliptin 2.5 bid and 216 patients treated with Linagliptin 5mg qd (466 in total).

outcome.title: HbA1c Change From Baseline at Week 12
outcome.description: HbA1c is measured as a percentage. Thus, this change from baseline reflects the Week 12 HbA1c percent minus the baseline HbA1c percent. Treatment means are adjusted for baseline HbA1c and use of prior oral antidiabetics (OADs) in addition to background metformin.
outcome.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) included all treated patients with a baseline and at least one on-treatment HbA1c measurement available. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used as the imputation rule.

measure.title: HbA1c Change From Baseline at Week 12
measure.description: HbA1c is measured as a percentage. Thus, this change from baseline reflects the Week 12 HbA1c percent minus the baseline HbA1c percent. Treatment means are adjusted for baseline HbA1c and use of prior oral antidiabetics (OADs) in addition to background metformin.
measure.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) included all treated patients with a baseline and at least one on-treatment HbA1c measurement available. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used as the imputation rule.

outcome.title: HbA1c Change From Baseline at Week 6 From Mixed Model Repeated Measures (MMRM) Analysis
outcome.description: Mixed model includes treatment, baseline HbA1c, use of prior oral antidiabetics (OADs) in addition to background metformin, week repeated within patient, week by treatment interaction.
outcome.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) included all treated patients with a baseline and at least one on-treatment HbA1c measurement available. No imputation was performed. Patients without a Week 6 value were handled by the statistical model.

measure.title: HbA1c Change From Baseline at Week 6 From Mixed Model Repeated Measures (MMRM) Analysis
measure.description: Mixed model includes treatment, baseline HbA1c, use of prior oral antidiabetics (OADs) in addition to background metformin, week repeated within patient, week by treatment interaction.
measure.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) included all treated patients with a baseline and at least one on-treatment HbA1c measurement available. No imputation was performed. Patients without a Week 6 value were handled by the statistical model.

outcome.title: HbA1c Change From Baseline at Week 12 From Mixed Model Repeated Measures (MMRM) Analysis
outcome.description: Mixed model includes treatment, baseline HbA1c, use of prior oral antidiabetics (OADs) in addition to background metformin, week repeated within patient, week by treatment interaction.
outcome.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) included all treated patients with a baseline and at least one on-treatment HbA1c measurement available. No imputation was performed. Patients without a Week 12 value were handled by the statistical model.

measure.title: HbA1c Change From Baseline at Week 12 From Mixed Model Repeated Measures (MMRM) Analysis
measure.description: Mixed model includes treatment, baseline HbA1c, use of prior oral antidiabetics (OADs) in addition to background metformin, week repeated within patient, week by treatment interaction.
measure.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) included all treated patients with a baseline and at least one on-treatment HbA1c measurement available. No imputation was performed. Patients without a Week 12 value were handled by the statistical model.

outcome.title: FPG Change From Baseline at Week 12
outcome.description: Change from baseline reflects the Week 12 FPG minus the baseline FPG. Treatment means are adjusted for baseline HbA1c, baseline fasting plasma glucose and use of prior oral antidiabetics (OADs) in addition to background metformin.
outcome.population: Patients from FAS with values for FPG at baseline and on-treatment. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used as the imputation rule.

measure.title: FPG Change From Baseline at Week 12
measure.description: Change from baseline reflects the Week 12 FPG minus the baseline FPG. Treatment means are adjusted for baseline HbA1c, baseline fasting plasma glucose and use of prior oral antidiabetics (OADs) in addition to background metformin.
measure.population: Patients from FAS with values for FPG at baseline and on-treatment. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used as the imputation rule.

analysis.estimate_desc: No non-inferiority margin was pre-defined for FPG

outcome.description: Mixed model includes treatment, baseline HbA1c, baseline FPG, use of prior oral antidiabetics (OADs) in addition to background metformin, week repeated within patient, week by treatment interaction.
outcome.population: Patients from FAS with values for FPG at baseline and on-treatment. No imputation was performed. Patients without a Week 12 value were handled by the statistical model.

measure.population: Patients from FAS with values for FPG at baseline and on-treatment. No imputation was performed. Patients without a Week 12 value were handled by the statistical model.

outcome.population: Patients from FAS with values for FPG at baseline and on-treatment. No imputation was performed. Patients without a Week 12 value were handled by the statistical model.

measure.description: Mixed model includes treatment, baseline HbA1c, baseline FPG, use of prior oral antidiabetics (OADs) in addition to background metformin, week repeated within patient, week by treatment interaction.
measure.population: Patients from FAS with values for FPG at baseline and on-treatment. No imputation was performed. Patients without a Week 12 value were handled by the statistical model.

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients With HbA1c Lowering by 0.5% or More at Week 12
outcome.description: Percentage of patients with HbA1c lowering by at least 0.5% after 12 weeks. The analysis was performed on the full analysis set (FAS) using NCF.
outcome.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) included all treated patients with a baseline and at least one on-treatment HbA1c measurement available. Patients without a value at Week 12 were analysed as non-responders

measure.title: Percentage of Patients With HbA1c Lowering by 0.5% or More at Week 12
measure.description: Percentage of patients with HbA1c lowering by at least 0.5% after 12 weeks. The analysis was performed on the full analysis set (FAS) using NCF.
measure.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) included all treated patients with a baseline and at least one on-treatment HbA1c measurement available. Patients without a value at Week 12 were analysed as non-responders

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients With Rescue Therapy
outcome.description: Percentage of patients with rescue therapy at Week 12. The analysis was performed on the full analysis set (FAS) using OC.

measure.title: Percentage of Patients With Rescue Therapy
measure.description: Percentage of patients with rescue therapy at Week 12. The analysis was performed on the full analysis set (FAS) using OC.

outcome.title: The Occurrence of a Treat to Target Efficacy Response (HbA1c <7.0%) After 12 Weeks of Treatment
outcome.description: Percentage of those patients with baseline HbA1c >= 7.0% who had HbA1c < 7% at Week 12. The analysis was performed on the full analysis set (FAS) using NCF.

measure.title: The Occurrence of a Treat to Target Efficacy Response (HbA1c <7.0%) After 12 Weeks of Treatment
measure.description: Percentage of those patients with baseline HbA1c >= 7.0% who had HbA1c < 7% at Week 12. The analysis was performed on the full analysis set (FAS) using NCF.

outcome.description: Percentage of those patients with baseline HbA1c >= 6.5% who had HbA1c < 6.5% at Week 12. The analysis was performed on the full analysis set (FAS) using NCF.

measure.description: Percentage of those patients with baseline HbA1c >= 6.5% who had HbA1c < 6.5% at Week 12. The analysis was performed on the full analysis set (FAS) using NCF.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication of the results of this trial are described in the investigator contract.
